intro: Vaccinium brachycerum, commonly known as the dwarf huckleberry, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its compact form and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in regions with cool, humid climates.
